content.description: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe is there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi guys!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey, Pheebs! Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. Oh, oh, how’d it go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, not so good. He walked me to the subway and said “We should do this again!”

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh. Ouch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? He said “we should do it again”, that’s good, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, no. Loosely translated “We should do this again” means “You will never see me naked”.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Since when?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Since always. It’s like dating language. Y’know, like “It’s not you” means “It is you”.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Or “You’re such a nice guy” means “I’m gonna be dating leather-wearing alcoholics and complaining about them to you”.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or, or, y’know, um, “I think we should see other people” means “Ha, ha, I already am”.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And everybody knows this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Cushions the blow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it’s like when you’re a kid, and your parents put your dog to sleep, and they tell you it went off to live on some farm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s funny, that, no, because, uh, our parents actually did, uh, send our dog off to live on a farm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Wh- hello? The Millners’ farm in Connecticut? The Millners, they had this unbelievable farm, they had horses, and, and rabbits that he could chase and it was- it w- …Oh my God, Chi Chi!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is helping Joey rehearse for a part.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: “So how does it feel knowing you’re about to die?”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “Warden, in five minutes my pain will be over. But you’ll have to live with the knowledge that you sent an honest man to die.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, that was really good!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks! Let’s keep going.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. “So. Whaddya want from me, Damone, huh?”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “I just wanna go back to my cell. ’Cause in my cell, I can smoke.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: “Smoke away.”
(Joey takes out a pack of cigarettes and a lighter. He fumbles and drops the lighter. Then he lights a cigarett, takes a drag, and coughs.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think this is probably why Damone smokes in his cell alone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Relax your hand!
(Joey lets his wrist go limp.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not so much!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, now try taking a puff.
(Joey tries and visibly winces.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright.. okay. No. Give it to me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No no no, I am not giving you a cigarette.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s fine, it’s fine. Look, do you wanna get this part, or not? Here.
(Joey reluctantly gives him the cigarette.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t think of it as a cigarette. Think of it as the thing that’s been missing from your hand. When you’re holding it, you feel right. You feel complete.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’miss it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nah, not so much. Alright, now we smoke. (Takes a puff.) Oh.. my.. God. (He continues to smoke.)

content.description: [Scene, Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe and Rachel is there.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no, no. They say it’s the same as the distance from the tip of a guy’s thumb to the tip of his index finger.
(The guys stretch out their fingers.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s ridiculous!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can I use.. either thumb?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, don’t tell me, don’t tell me! (Starts handing them out.) Decaf cappucino for Joey.. Coffee black.. Late.. And an iced tea. I’m getting pretty good at this!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, excellent.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good for me!
(The gang swaps all the drinks for what they ordered as Phoebe enters. She sits down without saying hi.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’okay, Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah- no- I’m just- it’s, I haven’t worked- It’s my bank.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did they do to you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s nothing, it’s just- Okay. I’m going through my mail, and I open up their monthly, you know, STATEMENT-

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Easy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: - and there’s five hundred extra dollars in my account.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, Satan’s minions at work again…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, ’cause now I have to go down there, and deal with them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you talking about? Keep it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not mine, I didn’t earn it, if I kept it, it would be like stealing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but if you spent it, it would be like shopping!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Okay, let’s say I bought a really great pair of shoes. Do you know what I’d hear, with every step I took? “Not-mine. Not-mine. Not-mine.” And even if I was happy, okay, and, and skipping- “Not-not-mine, not-not-mine, not-not-mine, not-not-mine…”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re with you. We got it.
(Chandler leans over the back of the couch out of sight.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. I’d- just- I’d never be able to enjoy it. It would be like this giant karmic debt.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Whaddya doing?
(Chandler tries to shrug nonchalantly but eventually he has to exhale a mouthful of smoke.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh! Oh, God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is this?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m smoking. I’m smoking, I’m smoking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I can’t believe you! You’ve been so good, for three years!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And this- is my reward!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hold on a second, alright? Just think about what you went through the last time you quit.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so this time I won’t quit!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohhh! Put it out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! I’m putting it out, I’m putting it out. (He drops it in Phoebe’s coffee.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no! I- I can’t drink this now!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright. I’m gonna go change, I’ve got a date.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This Alan again? How’s it goin’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ’s’going pretty good, y’know? It’s nice, and, we’re having fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So when do we get to meet the guy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let’s see, today’s Monday… Never.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, come on! Come on!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. Not after what happened with Steve.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you talking about? We love Schhteve! Schhteve was schhexy!.. Sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I don’t even know how I feel about him yet. Just give me a chance to figure that out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, then can we meet him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nope. Schhorry.

content.description: Iridium, Monica and Paula are at work.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean, why should I let them meet him? I mean, I bring a guy home, and within five minutes they’re all over him. I mean, they’re like- coyotes, picking off the weak members of the herd.

content.speaker: Paula
content.text: Listen. As someone who’s seen more than her fair share of bad beef, I’ll tell you: that is not such a terrible thing. I mean, they’re your friends, they’re just looking out after you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. I just wish that once, I’d bring a guy home that they actually liked.

content.speaker: Paula
content.text: Well, you do realise the odds of that happening are a little slimmer if they never get to meet the guy..

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is smoking out on the balcony, Phoebe is absent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let it go, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well, you didn’t know Chi Chi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you all promise?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! We promise! We’ll be good!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler? Do you promise to be good?
(Chandler makes a ‘Cross my heart’ sign. It starts to rain and he taps on the window.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You can come in, but your filter-tipped little buddy has to stay outside!
(Chandler sulkilty picks up a garbage can lid and uses it as an umbrella.)
(Phoebe enters, walks to the couch, sits down, and begins to read a letter without saying hi.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “Dear Ms. Buffay. Thank you for calling attention to our error. We have credited your account with five hundred dollars. We’re sorry for the inconvenience, and hope you’ll accept this- (Searches in her purse) - football phone as our free gift.” Do you believe this?! Now I have a thousand dollars, and a football phone!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What bank is this?
(The intercom buzzes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. It’s him. (On the intercom) Who is it?

content.speaker: Alan
content.text: It’s Alan.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler! He’s here!
(Chandler comes in, dripping wet.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, please be good, please . Just remember how much you all like me.
(She opens the door and Alan enters.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. Alan, this is everybody. Everybody, this is Alan.

content.speaker: Alan
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi, Alan.

content.speaker: Alan
content.text: I’ve heard schho much about all you guyschh!
(Everyone laughs.)
[Time lapse, Alan is leaving.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks. I’ll call you tomorrow. (Alan exits, to all) Okay. Okay, let’s let the Alan-bashing begin. Who’s gonna take the first shot, hmm?
(Silence.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: C’mon!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …I’ll go. Let’s start with the way he kept picking at- no, I’m sorry, I can’t do this, can’t do this. We loved him.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Loved him! Yeah! He’s great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute! We’re talking about someone that I’m going out with?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And did you notice…? (She spreads her thumb and index finger.)

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Know what was great? The way his smile was kinda crooked.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, yes! Like the man in the shoe!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …What shoe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: From the nursery rhyme. “There was a crooked man, Who had a crooked smile, Who lived in a shoe, For a… while…”
(Dubious pause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …So I think Alan will become the yardstick against which all future boyfriends will be measured.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What future boyfriends? Nono, I th- I think this could be, y’know, it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah. I’d marry him just for his David Hasselhof impression alone. You know I’m gonna be doing that at parties, right? (Does the impression)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what I like most about him, though?

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The way he makes me feel about myself.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah…

content.description: Central Perk, Monica is alone as Ross, Rachel, Chandler, and Joey enter dejectedly in softball gear.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.. how was the game?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well..

content.speaker: All
content.text: WE WON!! Thank you! Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fantastic! I have one question: How is that possible?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alan.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He was unbelievable. He was like that-that-that Bugs Bunny cartoon where Bugs is playing all the positions, right, but instead of Bugs it was first base-Alan, second base-Alan, third base-…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean, it-it was like, it was like he made us into a team.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep, we sure showed those Hassidic jewellers a thing or two about softball..

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can I ask you guys a question? D’you ever think that Alan is maybe.. sometimes..

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ..I dunno, a little too Alan?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, no. That’s impossible. You can never be too Alan.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it’s his, uh, innate Alan-ness that-that-that we adore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I personally could have a gallon of Alan.

content.description: A street, Phoebe walks up to a homeless person (Lizzie) she knows.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Lizzie.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Hey, Weird Girl.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I brought you alphabet soup.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Did you pick out the vowels?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. But I left in the Ys. ’Cause, y’know, “sometimes y”. Uh, I also have something else for you. (She searches in her purse.)

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Saltines?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, but would you like a thousand dollars and a football phone?

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: What? (She opens the envelope Phoebe has given her.) Oh my God, there’s really money in here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Weird Girl, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I want you to have it. I don’t want it.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: No, no, I ha-I have to give you something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, that’s fine, no.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Would you like my tin-foil hat?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. ’Cause you need that. No, it’s okay, thanks.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Please, let me do something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, alright, you buy me a soda, and then we’re even. Okay?

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Chandler’s office, Chandler looks around, opens his desk drawer, takes a puff of a cigarette, sprays around some air freshener, and takes some breath spray. He types for a little while, opens the drawer again, and takes another drag of the cigarette. While not paying attention, he sprays the breath spray around the room, takes a squirt of air freshener and gags.
A Street, Phoebe and Lizzie are at a hot dog vendor.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: Keep the change. (To Phoebe) Sure you don’t wanna pretzel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I’m fine.

content.speaker: Lizzie
content.text: See ya.
(Phoebe opens the can and reacts.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is telling everyone about her discovery.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A thumb ?!
(Phoebe nods.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Eww!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! I know, I opened it up and there it was, just floating in there, like this tiny little hitch-hiker!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe it’s a contest, y’know? Like, collect all five?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does, um, anyone wanna see?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Nooo!
(Chandler lights a cigarette.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, hey, don’t do that! Cut it out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s worse than the thumb!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, this is so unfair!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, why is it unfair?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I have a flaw! Big deal! Like Joey’s constant knuckle-cracking isn’t annoying? And Ross, with his over-pronouncing every single word? And Monica, with that snort when she laughs? I mean, what the hell is that thing? …I accept all those flaws, why can’t you accept me for this?
(An awkward silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …Does the knuckle-cracking bother everybody?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I could live without it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, is it, like, a little annoying, or is it like when Phoebe chews her hair?
(Phoebe spits out her hair.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, now, don’t listen to him, Pheebs, I think it’s endearing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, (Imitating Ross) “you do, do you”?
(Monica laughs and snorts.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know, there’s nothing wrong with speaking correctly.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: “Indeed there isn’t”… I should really get back to work.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, ’cause otherwise someone might get what they actually ordered.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh-ho-hooohhh. The hair comes out, and the gloves come on.
(They degenerate into bickering and Chandler happily starts to smoke, undisturbed.)

content.description: Iridium, Monica and Paula are working.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you ever go out with a guy your friends all really like?

content.speaker: Paula
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.. Well, I’m going out with a guy my friends all really like.

content.speaker: Paula
content.text: Waitwait.. we talking about the coyotes here? All right, a cow got through!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can you believe it? …Y’know what? I just don’t feel the thing . I mean, they feel the thing, I don’t feel the thing.

content.speaker: Paula
content.text: Honey.. you should always feel the thing . Listen, if that’s how you feel about the guy, Monica, dump him!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.. it’s gonna be really hard.

content.speaker: Paula
content.text: Well, he’s a big boy, he’ll get over it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, he’ll be fine. It’s the other five I’m worried about.

content.description: Cental Perk, Joey and Ross are persecuting Chandler about his smoking.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you have any respect for your body?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t you realise what you’re-you’re doing to yourself?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, y’know, I have had it with you guys and your cancer and your emphysema and your heart disease. The bottom line is, smoking is cool, and you know it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler? It’s Alan, he wants to speak to you.
content.parenthetical: holding the phone out to Chandler

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? He does? (taking the phone) Hey, buddy, what’s up! Oh, she told you about that, huh. Well, yeah, I have one now and then. Well, yeah, now. Well, it’s not that big- ..well, that’s true,.. Gee, y’know, no-one- no-one’s ever put it like that before. Well, okay, thanks! (He hands the phone back and stubs out his cigarette.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, he’s good.
content.parenthetical: to Ross, who has wandered up

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: If only he were a woman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.
(They give each other a dubious look.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyond except Monica and Joey is watching Lambchop.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, Lambchop. How old is that sock? If I had a sock on my hand for thirty years it’d be talking too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. I think it’s time to change somebody’s nicotine patch. (Does so.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Where’s Joey?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey ate my last stick of gum, so I killed him. Do you think that was wrong?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think he’s across the hall.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks. (Goes to fetch him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There y’go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, I’m alive with pleasure now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, you gonna have the rest of that Pop-Tart?.. Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does anyone want the rest of this Pop-Tart?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I might!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry. ..Y’know, those stupid soda people gave me seven thousand dollars for the thumb.

content.speaker: All
content.text: You’re kidding. Oh my God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And on my way over here, I stepped in gum. …What is up with the universe?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s going on?
content.parenthetical: dragged in by Monica, he has just gotten out of the shower

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing. I just think it’s nice when we’re all here together.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Even nicer when everyone gets to wear their underwear..

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, Joey..

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, God! (Hurriedly closes his legs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay..

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh! That was Lambchop!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, guys, we have to talk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, wait, I’m getting a deja vu …no, I’m not.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, we have to talk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There it is!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. It’s-it’s about Alan. There’s something that you should know. I mean, there’s really no easy way to say this.. uh.. I’ve decided to break up with Alan.
(They all gasp and clutch each other.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is there somebody else?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, nononono.. it’s just.. things change. People change.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We didn’t change..

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So that’s it? It’s over? Just like that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know.. you let your guard down, you start to really care about someone, and I just- I- (starts chewing her hair)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I- I could go on pretending-

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: -but that wouldn’t be fair to me, it wouldn’t be fair to Alan- It wouldn’t be fair to you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who-who wants fair? Y’know, I just want things back. Y’know, the way they were.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry..

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, she’s sorry! I feel better!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just can’t believe this! I mean, with the holidays coming up- I wanted him to meet my family-

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll meet somone else. There’ll be other Alans.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, yeah! Right!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you guys gonna be okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey hey, we’ll be fine. We’re just gonna need a little time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I understand.

content.description: A Restaurant, Monica is breaking the news to Alan.

content.speaker: Alan
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m, I’m really sorry.

content.speaker: Alan
content.text: Yeah, I’m sorry too. But, I gotta tell you, I am a little relieved.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Relieved?

content.speaker: Alan
content.text: Yeah, well, I had a great time with you.. I just can’t stand your friends.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is mopping around and eating ice cream.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Remember when we went to Central Park and rented boats?.. That was fun.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. He could row like a viking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Mmm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So how’d it go?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, y’know..

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did he mention us?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He said he’s really gonna miss you guys. (dubious look)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You had a rough day, huh.. c’mere. (She sits down and Ross strokes her forehead.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …That’s it. I’m getting cigarettes.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No no no!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t care, I don’t care! Game’s over! I’m weak! I’ve gotta smoke! I’ve gotta have the smoke!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If you never smoke again I’ll give you seven thousand dollars!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, alright.
